{"step_by_step_thinking": "The occlusal surface of the permanent maxillary first molar is the part of the tooth that comes into contact with the opposing tooth in the lower jaw. This surface is not oval or triangular. It is also not trapezoidal, which would imply that it has one pair of parallel sides. The occlusal surface of the permanent maxillary first molar is rhomboidal, meaning it has a diamond-like shape.", "answer_choice": "D. Rhomboidal"}
